topicv3: Agricultural Policies m1326884 170,Agricultural Research m1326207 197,Agricultural Supply Chain m1325993 194,Agribusiness m1326896 2179,Agricultural Finance m1326892 1059,Agricultural Risk and Security m1327607 1967

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Agricultural Sector Adjustment
            Loan for Tunisia. The principal objective of the program was
            to promote greater efficiency and economy in the increased
            production of agricultural products and in the use of public
            resources in the sector, including enhancing the role of the
            private sector in the provision of commercially-viable
            sector support services.  Bank's performance was
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was satisfactory.
            The key lessons learned were as follows: (i) the hybrid
            structure of the Loan, with a quick disbursing policy
            component and an investment component that supported
            sub-projects in the Ministry of Agriculture (MOA) budget,
            was not an effective instrument design; (ii) investment
            component was weakly conceived from the beginning and was
            never adequately integrated into supervision mission
            objectives; (iii)further, the coupling of disbursement on
            investment components with policy requirements for the
            second tranche release proved to be an inappropriate design,
            as recognized in eventually de-linking the two components;
            (iv) in fact, the problem arose due to delay in passage of a
            draft law through the National Assembly, as required for
            second tranche release; and (v) finally, there were no
            monitoring indicators established for the investment
            component, which resulted in some slippage in execution of
            works, and weak capacity to evaluate the early phase
            operations of sub-project components.
